clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of the New Norwegian Food Based Dietary Guidelines on Chronic Diseases in Colorectal Cancer Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of the New Norwegian Food Based Dietary Guidelines on Chronic Diseases in Colorectal Cancer Survivors

collaborator.agency: National Institute for Health and Welfare, Finland

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study to examine whether an intensive dietary intervention affects health measures and development of lifestyle diseases in colorectal cancer survivors.

detailed_description.textblock: The increased incidence and survival after treatment contributes to a rising number of people living with a previous cancer diagnosis. Cancer-survivors have an increased risk of developing other lifestyle diseases compared to an age-mathed general population. The aim of this study to examine whether a dietary changes affects health and development of lifestyle diseases after treatment for colorectal cancer. The diet in the study is based on the new Norwegian food-based dietary guidelines, and in addition focus is placed on foods which have been shown to inhibit inflammation or oxidative stress in epidemiological and experimental studies, as well as Norwegian and Nordic foods. The dietary intervention is combined with intensive follow-up to ensure high compliance to the diet.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in biomarkers of comorbid conditions over the intervention period
primary_outcome.description: Including but not limited to: blood pressure, LDL-/HDL-/VLDL-/oxLDL-/totalcholesterol, cholesterol efflux, triglyserides, HbA1c, blood sugar, BMI, body composition, waist and hip circumference, CEA

primary_outcome.measure: Change in biomarkers of inflammation and oxidative stress from baseline to 6 and 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Including but not limited to: CRP, interleukines/chemokines, isoprostanes, GSH:GSSG, FRAP, dROM

primary_outcome.measure: Compliance to intervention up to 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Compliance to the intervention tested via biomarkers in blood such as carotenoids and fatty acids profiles, and via self reporting in questionnaires

primary_outcome.measure: Change in physical function over the first 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Submaximal oxygen test, grip strenght and physical activity level

primary_outcome.measure: Change in dietary patterns during first 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaires, biomarkers of dietary intake and food diaries

secondary_outcome.description: All-cause mortality, diet-related chronic diseases (a priori defined), deaths attributed to cardiovascular diseases, cancers and non CVD-, non-cancer-, inflammatory diseases

secondary_outcome.measure: colorectal cancer-free survival and disease-free survival
whole genome transcription profiles and methylation patterns

secondary_outcome.description: Including but not limited to cardiovascular diseases, diabetes, recurring cancer, incident cancers, etc

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in biomarkers of comorbid conditions compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Including but not limited to: blood pressure, LDL-/HDL-/VLDL-/oxLDL-/totalcholesterol, cholesterol efflux, triglyserides, HbA1c, blood sugar, BMI, body composition, waist and hip circumference, CEA

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in biomarkers of inflammation and oxidative stress
secondary_outcome.description: Including but not limited to: CRP, interleukines/chemokines, isoprostanes, GSH:GSSG, FRAP, dROM

secondary_outcome.measure: Continued ompliance to intervention during follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Compliance to the intervention tested via biomarkers in blood such as carotenoids and fatty acids profiles, and via self reporting in questionnaires

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in physical function up to 15 years
secondary_outcome.description: Submaximal oxygen test, grip strenght and physical activity level

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in dietary patterns up to 15 years
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaires, biomarkers of dietary intake and food diaries

intervention.intervention_name: new norwegian food based dietary guidelines
intervention.description: several means will be applied to guide participarts to cohere to the dietary guidelines including access to clinical nutritionists, free food, food discounts, cooking courses, cookbook/recipies, study website, organized physical activity, etc

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- colorectal cancer (ICD10 C18-20) TNM Stage I-III
Exclusion Criteria:
- TNM stage 0 or IV
